intro: Monnina weberbaueri var. pachyantha, commonly known as the yellow monnina, is a flowering plant native to parts of South America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in arid or semi-arid environments, often in rocky soils. It has hairy leaves and stems, which help it retain moisture in dry conditions. This variety is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its vibrant floral display.
